title: 3D printed biostructures with live bacteria capture carbon dioxide from air at venice biennale
description: designboom speaks with living room collective’s lead and biodesigner andrea shin ling about the exhibition shown inside the canada pavilion. The post 3D printed biostructures with live bacteria capture carbon dioxide from air at venice biennale appeared first on designboom | architecture & design magazine.
author: matthew burgos I designboom
excerpt: living room collective uses cyanobacteria in 3D printed biostructures to capture carbon dioxide at venice architecture biennale 2025.
